result.execSummary:
The defendant William C. Giddings Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine/Methamphetamine/etc.(>3-10g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Eligible for the early release program.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence defendant is serving.

records.addlTxt:
11:03 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant William C. Giddings Jr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Russell Edward Hammer in court for William C. Giddings Jr.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Hammer is heard and they are ready to proceed with plea and sentencing. 
State is heard on sentencing recommendations and the criminal history of the defendant. Prison 18 month of initial confinement and 24 month of extended supervision, consecutive to any other sentence being served. Forfeiture

Attorney Hammer is heard on sentencing. 
State is heard on sentencing recommendations. 
Defendant comments. 

Court orders and imposes a sentence of 3.5 years to the prison system. 18 months initial confinement / 2 yrs of extended supervision, consecutive to any other sentence serving. 
138 days sentence credit. Eligible for the early release program. Court costs of $518.00.
Hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on November 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Letter to Court
Order to Produce

1:00 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant William C. Giddings Jr. appeared by video, in custody at Dodge Correctional.  Attorney Russell Edward Hammer appeared by video for William C. Giddings Jr.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Hammer is heard. 

Court reviews plea questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the constitutional and fundamental rights with Defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the elements of the charge with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the minimum / maximum penalties with defendant. Defendant states understanding. 

Court asks defendant for plea. Defendant enters a no contest plea. Court accepts the defendants no contest plea and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters plea. Court finds the defendant guilty. 

Ct 1 - 961.41(1m)(e)2 - Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine/Methamphetamine/etc.(>3-10g). No Contest. 

Attorney Hammer requests defendant to be brought back for sentencing. 
Attorney Steiner comments he will prepare the order to produce.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on October 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:18 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant William Charles Giddings Jr appeared by video, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 


Court finds probable cause.  

DA Requests:
5,000.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. No contract with PY or LY 

Defendant comments. 

Court orders a 5,000.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. No contact with PY or LY.

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant.
